channel.title: Localhost
channel.description: ok here is the issue i have a client (i know this is the server side help) and i changed all the ip's from 127.0.0.1 to my ip tyme.no-ip.info and then compiled then i log on and out and in my server run thing it still says localhosts. and on my download client that i put out there all connecting on localhost even though i changed the ip's. and no one can connect to my server ON MY CLIENT but when they use a different client they can log on because the other ip changer client is not connecting to loclhost like my client is (even though i changed the ip's in the gui and client.java and compiled) what im wondering is, is there anything serversided that i can do to fix this problem? if not what cann i do to fix if you know?

item.title: Localhost
item.dc:creator: @pokemonn pokemonn
item.description:
@pokemonn wrote:

i looked through the file searcher and no other ips except for my own even though the client is changed all ip’s to my ip the client still only connect to localhost

Read full topic

item.title: Localhost
item.dc:creator: @Nasz Nasz
item.description:
@Nasz wrote:

[quote=“Redemtion, post:5, topic:397903”][quote author=cruel ko link=topic=495035.msg3619269#msg3619269 date=1307252117]
then you didnt change all local host ip’s or you didnt compile right
[/quote]
I agree, try using the file searcher to look for the other ip’s that you may have missed. Thats what usually causes me the problems…[/quote]

Agreed with both of them, you probably just missed a ip while compiling or it compiled wrong.

Read full topic

item.description:

cruel ko:

then you didnt change all local host ip’s or you didnt compile right

I agree, try using the file searcher to look for the other ip’s that you may have missed. Thats what usually causes me the problems…

item.title: Localhost
item.dc:creator: @pokemonn pokemonn
item.description:
@pokemonn wrote:

yes people can connect to me using other clients not mine…

what people arent getting is that ITS ONLY MY CLIENT THAT HAS THIS ISSUE PEOPLE CSN CONNECT TO THE SERVER BUT NOT ON MY CLIENT BECAUSE THERE ONLY TRYING TO CONNECT USING LOCALHOST EVEN THOUGH I CHANGED THE IP’S sorry about caps i had to get my point across

Read full topic

item.title: Localhost
item.dc:creator: @pokemonn pokemonn
item.description:
@pokemonn wrote:

ok here is the issue i have a client (i know this is the server side help) and i changed all the ip’s from 127.0.0.1 to my ip tyme.no-ip.info and then compiled then i log on and out and in my server run thing it still says localhosts. and on my download client that i put out there all connecting on localhost even though i changed the ip’s. and no one can connect to my server ON MY CLIENT but when they use a different client they can log on because the other ip changer client is not connecting to loclhost like my client is (even though i changed the ip’s in the gui and client.java and compiled) what im wondering is, is there anything serversided that i can do to fix this problem? if not what cann i do to fix if you know?
